geneSummary: B2M, a tumor suppressor and regulator of the immune system, is inactivated by mutation or deletion in various cancer types including non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

mutationEffect.description: B2M truncating mutations can produce several forms of C-terminally truncated proteins. Expression of B2M mutations in lymphoma cell lines resulted in decreased protein stability and increased cancer cell evasion of immune surveillance compared to wildtype (PMID: 1898655, 22137796, 25294904).

variantSummary: The B2M T93Hfs*2 mutation is likely oncogenic.
